page.title: 03Settlement Patterns
page.content: There are only two real centres of population and even these are not complete villages. The larger of the two is{Wenhaston} and the other is {Bramfield.} Wenhaston is a rather scattered village with the older houses gathered around the heaths(sandlings) and with more modern infilling. Bramfield is a more nucleated village, but most of it is not included in this block of the survey. The farming areas dominate the block, and the settlement is evenly spaced. There is no dominant large estate or very large farm. Most farms are in the 100 to 200 hectare size and and although there has been some consolidation, there are few unoccupied houses.
